page.title: 19CHARD 750
page.content: This year, Chard celebrates its 750th year as a town, a charter having been signed by Bishop Jocelyn in 1235. To mark this occasion, many events have been staged, such as a{torchlight {procession}from the toll-house above Chard to the Guildhall. About 2000 people took part and 750 torches carried. This was followed by a firework display. A{community play also took place and was extremely successful, being written by two local residents. The community project was to build a{swimming pool,}and many fund raising activities occured- even the 'Radio 1 Roadshow' being broadcast nearby. The pool was opened on 11 June 1985 by{HRH Princess Anne-}the first royal visitor since King Charles II ! Many other shows, competitions, concerts, open days and the special carnival have been organised.
